executiveSummary: Christina pitched her company Hiccup on Shark Tank, seeking $200,000 for 10% equity. Hiccup offers a reusable silicone cup rental service for marathon hydration stations to reduce waste. Despite appreciation for her sustainability mission and entrepreneurial spirit, all Sharks declined to invest due to scalability and profitability concerns.

actionItems.task: Explore sponsorship opportunities with beverage or snack companies to scale the business
Reduce per-cup costs to better compete with disposable paper cups
Expand partnerships with large marathon events such as Boston or Chicago

nextSteps: Christina will continue to grow Hiccup independently, focusing on securing event sponsors and improving cost efficiency to enhance business scalability.
